Articles.Content:
I see a bunch of showcase threads here, all cool. But one for landers seems to be missing. Time to start one!

Individual base modules and self-landing rovers (no skycrane needed) are also accepted. I'll start.

My Ketholander version 2. This thing can land, refuel, return to orbit with full kethane tanks, and land again without touching the kethane. I've done several iterations of these things but the base design is always pretty similar. Regardless, it can land with ALL tanks full on the Mun so it is certified for all airless bodies except Tylo (and hey, it might be able to land empty, refuel, take off, and make orbit by converting kethane mid-flight; UNTESTED).

Yeah, This one is my best one so far...

Can drive around and explore and then simply take-off back to orbit again from Most planets and moons. I stopped making legged landers when I found that doing them with wheels is not much more difficult. It sure is nice to be able to go look around instead of just survey the immediate surroundings. My first rover had to re-dock to the landing craft to get back to orbit. It is much more convenient to have the rover itself have the ability to re-orbit such as the one depicted below.

Hover Orbiter (HO2B)
Wan't there a lander showcase thread already?
I scrolled through a bunch of pages, I believe I got all the way to page 10, and didn't see one. If there is, it's long dormant.

I scrolled through a bunch of pages, I believe I got all the way to page 10, and didn't see one. If there is, it's long dormant.

Well, let it be then.

I scrolled through a bunch of pages, I believe I got all the way to page 10, and didn't see one. If there is, it's long dormant.

Yup, found it on page 16, and there hasn't been activity for almost a month.

If you're interested: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/37745-Showcase-Post-your-Moon-Planet-Landers-Thread-Lander-building-guide

XD. I have a new interesting munlander I built. I'll get photos and add it. I really like the mechanism I used. The lander itself actually docks to a tanker/drive stage that then runs it interplanetary. Assuming I don't forget to disable crossfeed, it can get all the way to Duna and, assume I specialize the lander, all the way back (no guarantees of kerbin orbit, immediate return may be necessary).

EDIT: Let's try to keep this one on the front page then

Yeah, This one is my best one so far...

Can drive around and explore and then simply take-off back to orbit again from Most planets and moons. I stopped making legged landers when I found that doing them with wheels is not much more difficult. It sure is nice to be able to go look around instead of just survey the immediate surroundings. My first rover had to re-dock to the landing craft to get back to orbit. It is much more convenient to have the rover itself have the ability to re-orbit such as the one depicted below.

<SNIP>

What kinda engine clipping do you have going on there? It actually looks kinda like my jet engine mod part
There is no clipping done there. It's just the way the tanks attach to the larger tank. There is nothing special about the way they were put on.

Hang on, let me find my tiny lander...

Here it is! This is a tiny probe-based lander I sent to Eeloo.

Anyone have really tiny probe landers that could manage Bop, Pol, and Vall? I'm planning a large mission to Jool.
Nothing much, but I thought it was a good looking lander. Performed very well, too.

My new favorite in its early stages

Edited August 18, 2013 by Spartwo

ATM, this is the only thing I regularly use that could be called a lander.

It has a very characteristic stance with its angled leg pairs, and is a welcome sight for stranded kerbals.

It is a rescue/transport craft for the Kerbin Moons, and is closely based on my first successful three man land and return vessel, but far more efficient.

It lands with its leg tanks almost empty, these are decoupled on the way up, so they crash on the ground and are destroyed. At least, that's how it's supposed to work..

Edited August 18, 2013 by Tw1

=

Anyone have really tiny probe landers that could manage Bop, Pol, and Vall? I'm planning a large mission to Jool.

I don't have a tiny one but I have a big one!

Javascript is disabled. View full album

There's a Jool version of it as well, along with a tanker to refuel the drive stage in orbit.

(Note: Old Version)

Lovely landers guys and gals?

Edited August 21, 2013 by Majorjim
i was grumpy

Anyone have really tiny probe landers that could manage Bop, Pol, and Vall? I'm planning a large mission to Jool.

Although the craft files are long lost to the violence of the 0.21 update, I did land probes and rovers on all of Jool's moons except Tylo a while back with the Kodak Missions (Part 1 and Part 2). Feel free to check out those reports for inspiration!

As for my current landers, of course there's the Munshine V Apollo-style two-stager:

And currently being tested as part of the MOdular Mission System (MOMS) is this yet unnamed surface shuttle, capable of ferrying six Kerbals to and from all solid bodies except Tylo and Eve (where it can land, but can't get back):

Edited August 18, 2013 by Wayfare

Although the craft files are long lost to the violence of the 0.21 update, I did land probes and rovers on all of Jool's moons except Tylo a while back with the Kodak Missions (Part 1 and Part 2). Feel free to check out those reports for inspiration!

I like your lander design. Antennae on top, docking port/decoupler on the bottom, folding panels on the side, tall heavy legs, radial rockets, tall, thin profile. I based my design off yours, though with mods (I made it so my lander matches the style of my interplanetary vessel).

If it can land on the Mun, I'm sure it can manage Vall!

Edited August 18, 2013 by Sapphire

I like your lander design. Antennae on top, docking port/decoupler on the bottom, folding panels on the side, tall heavy legs, radial rockets, tall, thin profile. I based my design off yours, though with mods (I made it so my lander matches the style of my interplanetary vessel).

If it can land on the Mun, I'm sure it can manage Vall!

Thanks! That's a sleek-looking lander, very nice. And yeah the Mun is a good proving ground for landers. If it can land there it can manage any non-atmospheric body except Tylo and Moho, and you generally only need to add some chutes to tackle Laythe and Duna.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

I've had the greatest fun with my attempt at a one-fits-all lander.

Visiting far off places. -check

Finding I had to cut off excess drogue chutes before full-deployment to prevent rapid atmospheric dismantling in thick atmospheres. -check

Launching a 3 craft simultaneous sortie to Jool to take advantage of the launch window. -check

Solving the problem of Laythe by using the base-station as an elevated (and thusly disposable) launch pad for my Ascent Craft. -check

Using various engine combinations planned, and unplanned, in order to achieve various goals. -check

Immense satisfaction of having one Ascent Craft after another landing back on Kerbin, pilot intact and full of awe. -check

Edited August 20, 2013 by prysmatik

Hi all,

I'm a HUGE fan of KSP landers. It was my attempts at copying Mulbins Munbug from pictures alone that showed new ways of using the stock parts.

I'm totally hooked now! Here are a few of my landers.

First landing on the VAB roof in the mini lotus

A prototype, err.. stealth? no. umm. something lander, looks like batmans lander or something.

'nother batman shot

Love this thread, lots of cool landers here! Here are a few of my own:

Eve lander w/ rover:

Duna lander w/ rover: (that top part with the atomic rocket wasn't supposed to come down also lol)

Tiny Dres lander:

Checkin' out the SPH:

3-rover delivery lander: (landing legs are underneath but don't need to extend)
I posted this one on the old lander showcase. I believe this is the best screenshot for display.

My two stage "Apollo" lander.

Duna lander

Robotic lander and rover

any more landers? i want to see if anyone has developed a simple, cute one-kerbal lander that I can take on my first mission to Minmus (I know, ive been too busy developing shuttlecraft sstos to go anywhere but Low Kerbin Orbit and the Mun).

Here's a few of my favorite screenshots of landings I've accomplished.

Running around on the Mun...

My Big entrance to Gilly

A trip to Moho with a small explorer

Can you really call this a lander?

Edited October 3, 2013 by Jean Deaux
